metadata.title: CVE-2020-8623 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In BIND 9.10.0 -> 9.11.21, 9.12.0 -> 9.16.5, 9.17.0 -> 9.17.3, also affects9.10.5-S1 -> 9.11.21-S1 of the BIND 9 Supported Preview Edition, Anattacker that can reach a vulnerable system with a specially crafted querypacket can trigger a crash. To be vulnerable, the system must: * be runningBIND that was built with "--enable-native-pkcs11" * be signing one or morezones with an RSA key * be able to receive queries from a possible attacker

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
bind9-host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
bind9utils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
dnsutils - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
host - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libbind9-140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libdns-export162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libdns162 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libirs-export141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libirs141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libisc-export160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libisc160 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libisccc-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libisccc140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libisccfg-export140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
libisccfg140 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
liblwres141 - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
lwresd - 1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.10.3.dfsg.P4-8ubuntu1.17').
